message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.CYBER, cs.GR, cs.HC

Reasoning: 
- cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is the most likely category as the paper focuses on studying the social network of gamers in the Steam Community and how cheating behavior spreads through social mechanisms. 
- cs.SOC (Social and Behavioral Sciences) is also likely as the paper examines the social dynamics of cheating in online gaming communities. 
- cs.CYBER (Cybersecurity and Privacy) is another possible category as the paper discusses the costs of cheating in online gaming, including cyber crime. 
- cs.GR (Graphics) is less likely but still possible as the paper may involve visualizations of the social network and interaction data. 
- cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) is also less likely but possible as the paper may discuss the implications of the findings for designing mechanisms to deal with anti-social behavior in online social networks.
